intro: Streptogyne, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture. Streptogyne species are native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. These plants are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
